DataElement.preferredName: Patient Hyperthyroidism Personal Medical History Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether the patient had hyperthyroidism within 6 months prior to randomization.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to a patient's personal medical history (an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced) and hyperthyroidism (excessive functional activity of the thyroid gland).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Excessive functional activity of the thyroid gland.:an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: Overactivity of the thyroid gland resulting in overproduction of thyroid hormone and increased metabolic rate. Causes include diffuse hyperplasia of the thyroid gland (Graves' disease), single nodule in the thyroid gland, and thyroiditis. The symptoms are related to the increased metabolic rate and include weight loss, fatigue, heat intolerance, excessive sweating, diarrhea, tachycardia, insomnia, muscle weakness, and tremor.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
